meanings.definition: A person who is excessively proper or modest in speech, behavior, or dress.
meanings.sent1: The prude always wore long skirts and never used slang words.
meanings.sent2: She was often called a prude because she refused to join in the gossip.
meanings.sent3: The prude blushed at the mere mention of a romantic movie.
meanings.sent4: Her friends teased her for being a prude, but she didn't mind.
meanings.sent5: The prude's strict manners made her stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To behave in a prudish manner.
meanings.sent1: He would prude whenever someone told a dirty joke.
meanings.sent2: Don't prude around, just relax and have fun!
meanings.sent3: She decided to prude at the party, much to her friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: His refusal to watch the R-rated movie made him prude in his friends' eyes.
meanings.sent5: She tends to prude when the conversation turns too risque.
